Description: Bronze plastic lamp in the form of a mouse, the curled tail forming a handle. The flaring tubular nozzle curves up from between the front paws, under the chin; on each side of the nozzle is a long leaf. The filling-hole is pierced through the mouse's back, and is surrounded by a plain raised rim. The lamp stands on a flat base.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q3594)
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Dr Daniel Marie Fouquet (sale)
